artefact: Live fish and shellfish importer authorisation (England and Wales)

artefact.overview: You need authorisation to import live fish and shellfish into the UK
artefact.licence_short_description: Authorisation to import live fish and shellfish into the UK.
artefact.licence_overview:
If you wish to import live fish and shellfish into England and Wales, you need to be authorised by the [Fish Health Inspectorate (FHI)](http://www.cefas.defra.gov.uk/our-services/aquaculture/fish-health-inspectorate.aspx "Fish Health Inspectorate (FHI)"){:rel="external"} - part of the Centre for Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture Science (Cefas).

This includes imports intended for:

- fish farms
- 'put and take' fisheries
- restocking
- scientific research
- public aquaria and zoos
- spas and medical use (nibble fish)

You don't need to be authorised to import live or dead fish or shellfish for immediate human consumption or immediate processing for human consumption. However, imports from outside the European Union (EU) will require health and hygiene certification.

To become authorised you must complete an application or the [type of import.](http://www.food.gov.uk/business-industry/imports/want_to_import/fisheryproducts/#.UGRkfGPLyxI "type of iimport"){:rel="external"}

If you intend to hold fish on your own site you must also include a biosecurity measures plan with your application. This needs to be documented and approved by the FHI in order for authorisation to be granted.

You don't need to pay an application fee.

##Conditions

Once you are authorised you must notify FHI or Animal Health - if you are importing live fish or shellfish from outside of the EU - at least 24 hours in advance of your import arriving in England or Wales.

Consignments need to be accompanied by health certificates if they are from outside the EU or are species susceptible to, or carriers of, an EU controlled disease.

If you intend to introduce imported fish into inland waters, including fisheries, in the UK you must obtain section 30 consent from the Environment Agency. If you are introducing non-native fish, you also need an Import of Live Fish Act licence from Cefas.

##Fines and penalties

%If you fail to apply for authorisation when required to do so you may be faced with an unlimited fine.%


*[Cefas]: Centre for Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture Science
